summary: Elon Musk posted a segment from a year-old Yahoo Financeinterview with Nvidia CEO Jensen Huang . Huang called Tesla(NASDAQ:TSLA) “far ahead in self-driving cars” and predicted that every automaker will need to follow suit .  Huang praised Tesla’s use of end-to-end generative AI in its Full Self-Driving system . “The best way to teach these AIs how the physical world behaves is through video,” he said .  Future Fund managing director Gary Black recently voiced concern about investor expectations tied to Tesla's Robotaxi rollout . Huang expects the term “supervised autonomy” to become more common as Tesla moves closer to launching its ride-hailing service in Austin .  Tesla plans tolaunch the Robotaxis by the end of June, starting with over 10 vehicles . Musk dismissed the idea of working with ride-hailing company Uber Technologies (NYSE:UBER), hinting instead at a proprietary Tesla platform where owners could add or remove their vehicles .  Safer, More Convenient, It's 'More Fun To Drive' cars . Smart cars are safer, more convenient and more fun to drive, experts say .

Technology giants helped drag the S&P 500 to the brink of a bear market in April . Nvidia Corp. put a bow on a better-than-expected earnings season for Big Tech last week by delivering a strong outlook for revenue . Traders are betting the group is poised to lift the broader market .  The S&P 500 Index is within 4% of its February record high . Much of the rebound is fueled by easing tensions between the US and its trade partners . Tesla Inc. is up 56% since the benchmark bottomed out on April 8, while Nvidia and Microsoft have gained 40% .  Shares of Apple and Amazon face greater risks from tariffs due to products imported . Bloomberg’s Magnificent Seven gauge is priced at 30 times projected profits, according to data compiled by Bloomberg .  Big Tech’s rich valuations are well above the average of 18.6 times over the past decade . Barry Knapp, managing partner at Ironsides Macroeconomics, has more exposure to industrials, materials, energy and financials in anticipation of a capital spending recovery in the second half of the year .  The Magnificent Seven profit estimates in 2025 have stayed steady over the past two months . The group is projected to deliver profit growth of 15%, roughly in-line with analysts’ expectations . Tech “could be that catalyst later on to actually see the market re-accelerate later in the year,” says Truist’s chief market strategist . Tesla CEO Elon Musk has recently sparked discussions about U.S. fiscal concerns . Bitwise CEO Hunter Horsley has pitched Musk’s remarks as a case for Bitcoin .  Bitcoin CEO Hunter Horsley pitches it as a case for Bitcoin . U.S. Treasury Secretary Scott Bessent says growth is the only way to get out of fiscal quagmire .  Horsley’s sentiments come as efforts to accelerate GDP growth are likely to involve increasing the monetary supply to stimulate economic activity . Bitcoin proponents argue that the digital asset has the potential to act as a hedge against such currency debasement, similar to gold, due to its scarcity .  Hayes compared the current phase of the market to Q3 2022 . At last look, Bitcoin is up over 60% since Trump’s election victory, trading at $109,000 . Hayes’ 2028 price target suggests that the asset has the potential for a 10x surge .  Bitwise CEO Reacts To Elon Musk's call to Accelerate GDP Growth . Since 2010, Tesla shares have risen in value by nearly 28,000% . An original investment of just $36 would have turned into $1 million over that time period . Starting an electric car company from scratch is incredibly difficult .  Tesla has proven to the market how an electric vehicle (EV) maker should scale . More than 90% of Tesla's vehicles sales come from its budget Model 3 and Model Y models . This is a big reason why the company is now worth more than $1 trillion .  Lucid has been following Tesla's paved path for growth . Right now, the company sells just two luxury models: the Lucid Air and the all new Gravity SUV platform . Growth is picking up considerably thanks to the recent introduction of the Gravity SUV . Analysts predict 73% sales growth this year, with another 96% in 2026 .  Lucid's long-term growth prospects are exciting but don't expect shares to go in a straight line higher . From 2014 to 2019, Tesla's sales grew from $3 billion to more than $20 billion . Tesla's history proves that high-growth stocks require extreme patience, even during periods of heavy growth .  Lucid Group wasn’t one of The Motley Fool Stock Advisor’s top 10 stocks . The road forward will be bumpy, suitable for risk-tolerant, long-term investors only . Consider when Netflixmade this list on December 17, 2004... if you invested $1,000 at the time of our recommendation,you’d have $651,049!  Lucid Group stock could be your ticket to becoming a millionaire . The company has more than 30,000 employees . Lucid is one of the fastest-growing companies in the world to date .

Tesla's access to capital gives it durable competitive edge . Its robotaxi business is proof that Tesla can afford to think big . Profitably investing in electric car stocks has proven difficult over the decades .  Tesla was launched in 2003, but its first model, the Roadster, didn't reach customers until 2008 . RivianandLucid Motors, for example, took roughly a decade to go from idea stages to actually producing and selling their first models . Tesla is by far the largest pure-play EV company in North America .  Tesla could raise $30 billion in new cash by diluting shareholders by just 2.5% . That ability also gives debt holders more confidence, lowering the cost of debt for Tesla . The EV maker has already unveiled its upcoming robotaxi vehicle, the Cybercab .  Some analysts think Tesla's robotaxi service will soon "proliferate" and achieve a stranglehold on the U.S. ride-hailing market . Tesla is currently facing sales declines in its core EV business . I'm skeptical of Wood's optimistic timelines and projections . Still, the upside potential is clear .  Tesla's current $1 trillion market cap will look like a relative bargain, and there's no reason to wait to establish a position . Tesla should be a decade-long holding, not a short-term bet on the company's near-term prospects .
